00022 /* standard includes. */
00023 #include <stdio.h>
00024 #include <unistd.h>
00025 #include <string.h>
00026 #include <fcntl.h>
00027 #include <ctype.h>
00028 #include <sys/stat.h>
00029 #include <errno.h>
00030 
00031 #include <netinet/in.h>
00032 
00033 /* my includes. */
00034 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00035 
00036 /* local defines. */
00037 #define OPEN_MAX_GUESS 256      /* this is a suitable value. */
00038 #define BIN_BUF_LEN 128         /* is used for binary checking. */
00039 
00040 /* function prototypes. */
00041 bool check_file (const char *, cint);
00042 void close_all_fds (register int);
00043 bool remove_file (unique);
00044 bool ascii_file (const char *);
00045 
00046 /* functions. */
00047 /* the following function tries to check a file. */
00048 bool
00049 check_file (const char *file, cint mode)
00050 {
00051   int rval;
00052   bool f_state = false;
00053 
00054   /* check the file. */
00055   if ((rval = access (file, mode)) < 0)
00056     f_state = true;
00057 
00058   return (f_state) ? false : true;
00059 }
00060 
00061 /* the following function closes
00062    all file descriptors >= `fd'. */
00063 void
00064 close_all_fds (register int fd)
00065 {
00066   /* max opened files a process can have. */
00067   int fdlimit = sysconf (_SC_OPEN_MAX);
00068 
00069   /* what happened? */
00070   if (fdlimit < 0)
00071     fdlimit = OPEN_MAX_GUESS;
00072 
00073   /* try closing all file descriptors >= `fd'. */
00074   while (fd < fdlimit)
00075     close (fd++);
00076 }
00077 
00078 /* the following function tries to remove the file
00079    from the system. on success returns true, but,
00080    on error false. */
00081 bool
00082 remove_file (unique file)
00083 {
00084   bool state = true;
00085 
00086   /* does the file exist? is the file removable? */
00087   if (check_file (file, F_OK))
00088     if (unlink (file) < 0)
00089       state = false;
00090 
00091   return state;
00092 }
00093 
00094 /* the following function tries to see
00095    if the file is a regular ascii file. */
00096 bool
00097 ascii_file (const char *file)
00098 {
00099   /* does the file exist and is readable? */
00100   if (!check_file (file, F_OK | R_OK))
00101     return false;
00102   else
00103     {
00104       /* structure for keeping file's information. */
00105       struct stat stbuf;
00106 
00107       /* try to get file's information. */
00108       if (stat (file, &stbuf) < 0)
00109         {
00110           fprintf (stderr, "%s: `%s' %s", "stat() error for", file,
00111                    strerror (errno));
00112           return false;
00113         }
00114 
00115       /* is the file a directory? */
00116       if (S_ISDIR (stbuf.st_mode))
00117         return false;
00118 
00119       /* is the file a block device file? */
00120       if (S_ISBLK (stbuf.st_mode))
00121         return false;
00122 
00123       /* is the file a character device file? */
00124       if (S_ISCHR (stbuf.st_mode))
00125         return false;
00126 
00127       /* is the file a fifo file? */
00128       if (S_ISFIFO (stbuf.st_mode))
00129         return false;
00130     }
00131 
00132   /* it seems that the file is a regular ascii one. */
00133   return true;
00134 }
